q: 3.45 pm: Afternoon, Josh Halliday here taking over from Matthew Weaver . This just in: Chancellor George Osborne has been defending Andy Coulson . " Andy Coulson did a good job as director of communications," he said. There was never any complaints about how he did that job- which is pretty unique when you look at the people who've done that job in the past. It was George Osborne , you might recall, who personally suggested hiring Andy Coulson in 2007 after his resignation as editor of News of the World. 2.54 pm: My colleagues James Robinson and Vikram Dodd have the "The head of the Metropolitan police said today that "no stone will be left unturned in the fresh investigation into the News of the World phone hacking allegations announced yesterday, four years after the initial convictions in the case." hacking of phones belonging to Princes David Cameron and Harry on his watch. Andy Coulson , who became Tony Blair David Cameron 's director of communications after last year's election, unexpectedly quit overnight conceding that his involvement in the affair made it difficult to give 110 per cent to his job. His departure sent shockwaves around Westminister and came just hours after the sudden resignation of one of Labour's most senior MPs, shadow chancellor Alan Johnson, who stepped down on Thursday night
